result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis James Lyon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Curtis James Lyon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Curtis James Lyon was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Curtis James Lyon was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Order granting civil judgment.

11:15 AM Defendant Curtis James Lyon not in Court. Maura Melka appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant was released from Dane County Jail on 8/2/19, due to the probation agent dropping the hold. Defendant may not have gotten notice of this hearing. The original notice was returned to the Clerk marked defendant not in Dane County Jail. Atty Eagon also conducted the initial appearance with this defendant. Discussion was held on if this will need a special prosecutor. State requested a civil judgment for unpaid financial obligations. Court granted the request. 11:24 AM.

Motion and Order for Payment of Legal Fees per statement submitted by Atty Davis
Restitution Stipulation filed.
Filed by Atty Richard Davis
Filed by Atty Richard Davis

Defendant Curtis James Lyon in court with attorney Richard G. Davis.  Christine Marie Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 2&3. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld on both counts, 2 years probation, conds: $543 costs, $343 costs. Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Complete domestic abuse counseling.  Maintain absolute sobriety.Submit DNA sample.Additional condition on ct. 3 is 20 days jail to be served at agent's discretion and during term of probation.. Huber granted under jail rules. $250 restitution. No jail credit. Ct. 1 dismissed.

Defendant, Curtis James Lyon, appeared.  appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds defendant indigent, appoints Atty Rich Davis, at the rate of $70.00 per hour, defendant to repay the county at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 4/15/16 and on each month thereafter until paid in full,

Defendant, Curtis James Lyon, appeared. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant requesting contact w/C.P., Atty Kohlwey states victim is fine w/defendant having contact w/son, Court modifies contact w/C.P only through telephone/text messaging to set up child placement, child placement exchange to be done through 3rd party, Court approves, Defendant may have contact w/C.P. through telephone/text messaging to set up child placement, child placement exchange to be done through 3rd party, defendant may have contact w/D.L., all other conditions remain in effect,

Defendant, Curtis James Lyon, appeared with Attorney Tristan Eagon. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $5,000 recog. bond with felony conds., no contact with C.P., her residence, workplace, her children. May return one time with officer to get belongings.
